comment:
Johnny's whole life is always being watched cause of who he is. When she did that to him, everyone believed her, all the studio heads, everyone had her side and at this point he was losing jobs left and right. For something like this to happen to a person like him whos life depends on the crowd and popular vote , he thought his life was over, she (the women he loved ) turned everyone against him. He probably felt like he had no way out, and worst of all for this type of betrayal to be done to someone by someone, that they most love. Its traumatizing for anyone. He's human, not a god, he's a person. Any person would of broken under those circumstances. Lucky he has amazing friends and people to keep him afloat, and to hold him up when he's wings were broken... That's what we are here for as well... To support an angle when they forget, that they can fly above all darkness.  

Johnny Depp, I hope you know just how much we love you and support, never give up cause your our star. The one that burns bright, so keep inspiring to be you. Cause souls like yours are the reason that so many others shine, Inspiration is what you are.
 <3 Love you Daddy J  #JusticeForJohnny

comment: At 3:16 you clearly hear her mask slip. She's been trying to seem concerned (not that successful because she's too calm) but then she slips and her "put the knife down" sounds annoyed and then she repeats "just put the fucking knife down" chuckling as if she's watching a child do something cute or silly...Usually, when peoples emotions switch this fast instead of slowly fading, they aren't genuine. That's something you often see ppl in police interviews do. I think she's pretenting and this is where she slips back into her default persona she has built over the years, but it doesn't fit in this case. That's basically some Chris Watts & co. style behaviour right there.

author: Jesse

comment:
The fact that there are comments of people who can't see how abusive this video was on her part obviously do not understand the gaslighting tactic. Would this be disturbing, absolutely but it's not abusive on his part. He needs help, true as self-h*rm is a terrible coping mechanism (it's about having control over your pain it's easier to accept hurting yourself than your loved one hurting you.)

 It may appear that she's trying to stop him but she's not, she's instigating it. Anyone who has been abused in this manner can see this clear as day. AH is the abuser here (and in every recording), not JD. 

For anyone who wishes to argue this don't @ me, educate yourself instead because I've been there, I know better. I will not be checking back or responding either.

author: Burcu 08

comment:
Maybe he is sick, maybe just hurt, maybe intoxicated. I don't know. The questions you should be askig are: 
1.Why record something like that? Yes, someone threatening to cut himself is scary to watch. Recording it would be the last thing that would come to my mind in a situation like that. 
2. Why present this in court? What exactly does this prove? Does it prove that he hit her on one of the alleged occasions? No, it doesn't. Does it prove that he cut off his own finger in Australia, because in this recording he wanted to cut himself? No, it doesn't. 
People who self-harm need help, no doubt. Does this make you an abusive monster? No, it does not. She's trying to air as much dirty laundry as she can, because she doesn't really have a lot of evidence to back up her claims. Which makes me question her motives behind this recording even more.
